page.title: 02CRAFTS
page.content: Richard Scaife is a skilled blacksmith who lives in a cottage which was once a groom's cottage,owned by the Grenvilles at Penstowe Manor.Attached to the house and woekshop is a museum and Cornish crafts shop. He makes fire canopies,gates,bannisters and many of his own tools. He enjoys creating unusual objects and once made some lights in the shape of a cobra's head. The Queen Mother commissioned him to make a boot valet. The hours he works vary depending on the work load. In the museum are a plough,huge bellows, stove from the railway at Bridgerule, a butter churner, turnip cutter and wool scales. In the craft shop you will find a big range of Cornish crafts, turned wooden objects,clocks, handmade clothes, pottery, pictures, lights, leather purses and jewellery.
